p: This medicinal herb belongs to the family of Lamiaceae and it is also known as sweet basil [ 149, 181]. It is mostly used in industries as food, perfumes and cosmetics [ 181] due to its potent antiviral, anti-inflammatory, antioxidant and antibacterial activities [ 180, 181, 183, 184]. Moreover, it contains several bioactive components such as phenolic compounds, flavonoids and anthocyanin extracted from the whole plant of O. basilicum [ 182, 183, 184]. This herb has been used for HIV treatment and showed very good potential to inhibit the replication of the HIV virus, and blocks further viral processing [ 149, 181].
